form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Sheehy (for himself and Mr. Justice) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To allow certain qualified law enforcement officers and retired law enforcement officers to carry concealed firearms to protect children in school zones.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Police Officers Protecting Children Act.

section.header: Certain qualified law enforcement officers and retired law enforcement officers allowed to carry a concealed firearm, and discharge a firearm, in a school zone
section.text: Section 922(q) of title 18, United States Code, is amended—

subparagraph.text: in clause (vi), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon; and
by redesignating clause (vii) as clause (ix) and inserting after clause (vi) the following:

clause.text: by a qualified law enforcement officer, as defined in section 926B, who is authorized under that section to carry a concealed firearm, if the firearm is concealed;
by a qualified retired law enforcement officer, as defined in section 926C, who is authorized under that section to carry a concealed firearm, if the firearm is concealed; or

subparagraph.text: in clause (iii), by striking ; or and inserting a semicolon;
in clause (iv), by striking the period and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

clause.text: by a qualified law enforcement officer, as defined in section 926B, who is authorized under that section to carry a concealed firearm; or
by a qualified retired law enforcement officer, as defined in section 926C, who is authorized under that section to carry a concealed firearm.
